title: BrightData Web Fetcher
description: Search Google web results or fetch web content. Two simple actions: 'search' for finding information (supports multiple queries), 'fetch' for opening URLs (supports multiple URLs). Let AI decide when to search vs fetch.

userSettings.name: serpApiKey
userSettings.label: BrightData SERP API Key
userSettings.description: Your BrightData API key for Google search requests.

userSettings.name: serpZone
userSettings.label: SERP Zone ID
userSettings.description: BrightData zone identifier for SERP API requests. Leave default unless using a custom zone.

userSettings.name: unlockerApiKey
userSettings.label: BrightData Web Unlocker API Key
userSettings.description: Your BrightData API key for bypassing website protections when fetching webpages.

userSettings.name: unlockerZone
userSettings.label: Web Unlocker Zone ID
userSettings.description: BrightData zone identifier for Web Unlocker API requests. Leave default unless using a custom zone.

userSettings.name: openaiApiKey
userSettings.label: OpenAI API Key
userSettings.description: Your OpenAI API key for content extraction and analysis.

openaiSpec.name: brightdata_web_fetcher
openaiSpec.description: Search Google web results or fetch web content. Two actions: 'search' for finding information (returns headlines/links), 'fetch' for reading content from URLs. Strategy: search first to find relevant URLs, then fetch specific URLs to read full content. Both actions support multiple parallel requests.

action.description: 'search': Find information on Google web search (supports multiple queries in parallel). 'fetch': Read content from URLs (supports multiple URLs in parallel).

query.description: For search action: Single search query or array of up to 5 different search queries to execute in parallel.

url.description: For fetch action: Single URL or array of URLs to fetch content from in parallel.

gl.description: Country targeting for search. Examples: 'us' (United States), 'jp' (Japan), 'de' (Germany), 'fr' (France), 'uk' (United Kingdom). Defaults to 'us'.

num.description: Number of search results to return. Must be between 10-100 in steps of 10. Defaults to 10.

tbs.description: Time-based search filter. 'qdr:h' (past hour), 'qdr:d' (past 24 hours), 'qdr:w' (past week), 'qdr:m' (past month), 'qdr:y' (past year). Use for recent/current events.
